entry.summary:

Rating: General AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 41,462Chapters: 7/?Kudos: 15

Summary: In Camelot, the splendid city that rules over the twelve districts, the Games are just another annual spectacle to entertain and reaffirm power. For Merlin, a young man from the harsh and forgotten District 7, being chosen in the harvest means accepting an almost certain death... until he truly meets Arthur Pendragon, son of Queen Ygraine Pendragon and the favorite face of Camelotian propaganda. Arthur is not a mentor by choice, but his charm and popularity make him the perfect image to accompany the Crown Contenders. Between training sessions and secret conversations, the cold formality transforms into something deeper: an attraction as intense as it is impossible. In a world where the borders between Camelot and the districts are impassable walls, Merlin and Arthur will have to face not only the threat of the Games but also the laws and prejudices that seek to keep them apart. Summary: It’s there, suffocating under the golden hues of the morning sun, that Arthur first experienced what it must feel like to truly believe in something.-----Sometimes, he’d hear someone wax poetic about their faith. [..] They’d all told him about the same - that one day they just knew. They looked around at the world around them and found miracles and intention. Realized that surely, something or someone had to be the cause. Surely, there was a point to this. There was meaning. Arthur had never understood it. He’d never needed faith. Never needed blind obedience, or trust in some entity he could not see much less touch. Did not experience that Knowing. Do something. Let that Knowing escape him like a hymn.
